title: Word and Object

Quine has argued that the set-theoretical implementation of the concept of the ordered pair is a paradigm for the clarification of philosophical ideas. The general notion of such definitions or implementations is discussed in Thomas Forster, Reasoning about Theoretical Entities
of Relations” is reprinted, together with a valuable commentary on pages 224ff., in Jean van Heijenoort, From Frege to Gödel: A Source Book in Mathematical Logic, 1879–1931

Van Heijenoort states the simplification this way: “By giving a definition of the ordered pair of two elements in terms of class operations, the note reduced the theory of relations to that of classes.” Casimir Kuratowski’s argument is in “Sur la notion de l’ordre dans la Théorie des Ensembles
